1.q_string: A cord is wound around the circumference of a bicycle wheel (without tyre) of diameter \(1 m\). A mass of \(2 kg\) is tied to the end of the cord and it is allowed to fall from rest. The weight falls \(2 m\) in \(4 s\). The axle of the wheel is horizontal and the wheel rotates with its plane vertical. The angular acceleration produced is (Take \(g = 10 ms^{–2}\))

The track shown in the figure ends in a circular track of radius \(r\) with centre at \(O\). A small solid sphere of mass \(m\) rolls from rest without slipping from a point \(A\) at a height \(h = 6r\) from the level ground. What is the speed of the sphere when it reaches a point \(B\) at height r above the level ground?
In the rectangular lamina \(ABCD\) shown in the figure below, \(a = AB = BC/2\). The moment of inertia of the lamina is minimum along the axis passing through

Three particles, each of mass '\(m\)' \(g\), are situated at the vertices of an equilateral triangle \(ABC\) of side \(l\) cm (as shown in the figure). The moment of inertia of the system about a line \(AX\) perpendicular to \(AB\) in the plane of \(ABC\) in \(gram-cm^2\) unit will be
A thin uniform metallic triangular sheet of mass \(M\) has sides \(AB = BC = L\) as shown in the figure. What is its moment of inertia about axis \(AC\) lying in the plane of the sheet?

Circular loops \(A\) and \(B\) of radii '\(r_A\)' and '\(r_B\)', respectively are made from a uniform wire. The ratio of their moments of inertia about axes passing through their centres and perpendicular to their planes is \(\frac{I_{A}}{I_{B}}=8\). Then, \(\frac{r_A}{r_B}\) is equal to

Four tiny masses are connected by a rod of negligible mass as shown in the figure.



The moment of inertia of the system about axis \(AB\) is

A circular disc of radius \(R\) is free to oscillate about an axis passing through a point on its rim and perpendicular to its plane. The disc is turned through an angle of \(60°\) and released. Its angular velocity when it reaches the equilibrium position will be
Four forces are applied to a wheel of radius \(20 cm\) as shown in the figure. The net torque produced by the forces is

q_option: retards the motion of the sphere
has no effect on the motion of the sphere
is independent of the velocity of the sphere
1.q_string:
Directions: The question below is based on the following passage.

A hollow sphere of mass \(M\) and radius \(R\) is initially at rest on a horizontal rough surface. It moves under the action of a constant horizontal force \(F\) as shown in the figure.

The frictional force between the sphere and the surface

q_option: Statement-1 is True, statement-2 is True; statement-2 is the correct explanation for statement-1.
Statement-1 is True, statement-2 is True; statement-2 is not the correct explanation for statement-1.
Statement-1 is True, statement-2 is False.
Statement-1 is False, statement-2 is True.
1.q_string:
Directions: The following question contains statement-1 (Assertion) and statement-2 (Reason) followed by 4 choices (1), (2), (3) and (4), out of which only one is correct.

Statement-1: If there is no external torque on a body about its centre of mass, the velocity of the centre of mass remains constant.

Statement-2:  The linear momentum of an isolated system remains constant.

q_option: Statement-1 is true, Statement-2 is true and Statement-2 is the correct explanation for Statement-1.
Statement-1 is true, Statement-2 is true but Statement-2 is not the correct explanation for Statement-1.
Statement-1 is true, Statement-2 is false.
Statement-1 is false, Statement-2 is true.
1.q_string:
Directions: In the following question, Statement-1 (Assertion) is followed by Statement-2 (Reason). The question has the following four choices, out of which only one choice is correct.

Statement-1:  A sphere and a cylinder slide without rolling from rest from the top of an inclined plane. They will reach the bottom with the same speed.

Statement-2: Bodies of all shapes, masses and sizes slide down a plane with the same acceleration.

A uniform circular disc of radius 'R' lies in the 'X - Y' plane with its centre coinciding with the origin of the coordinate system. Its moment of inertia about an axis lying in the 'X - Y' plane, parallel to the 'X'-axis, passes through a point on the 'Y'-axis at a distance 'y' = 2R   is I<sub>1</sub>. Its moment of inertia about an axis lying in a plane perpendicular to 'X - Y' plane, passing through a point on the 'X'-axis at a distance 'x' = d, is I<sub>2</sub>. If I<sub>1</sub> = I<sub>2</sub>, the value of 'd' is

q_option: Statement-1 is true, Statement-2 is true and Statement-2 is the correct explanation for Statement-1.
Statement-1 is true, Statement-2 is true but Statement-2 is not the correct explanation for Statement-1.
Statement-1 is true, Statement-2 is false.
Statement-1 is false, Statement-2 is true.
1.q_string:
Directions: In the following question, Statement-1 (Assertion) is followed by Statement-2 (Reason). The question has the following four choices, out of which only one choice is correct.
Statement-1: 
A solid cylinder of mass M and radius R rolls down an inclined plane of height h. The rotational kinetic energy of the cylinder when it reaches the bottom of the plane is Mgh/3.
Statement-2: 
The total energy of the cylinder remains constant throughout its motion.

q_option: Statement-1 is true, Statement-2 is true and Statement-2 is the correct explanation for Statement-1.
Statement-1 is true, Statement-2 is true, but Statement-2 is not the correct explanation for Statement-1.
Statement-1 is true, Statement-2 is false.
Statement-1 is false, Statement-2 is true.
1.q_string:
Directions: In the following question, Statement-1 (Assertion) is followed by Statement-2 (Reason). The question has the following four choices, out of which only one choice is correct.
Statement-1:
Two solid spheres of the same radius, one made of steel and the other of aluminium, are released from rest from the top of an inclined plane at the same time. The two spheres will reach the bottom at the same time.
Statement-2:
The linear acceleration down the plane is independent of the mass of the sphere.
